name: Holiday Inn Runcorn

reviews.title: Don't use the bar!!
reviews.text: Rip off bar prices, treble the local bar prices every time you get a drink your charged different rates and given excuses... Poor service no follow up from complaints. Would not go back or use holiday inn ever again after this service .
I cannot recommend this hotel. Why not? £15 for internet access. Complete rip-off by Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Just don't...

reviews.text: This hotel is oK if your looking for a hotel fairly close to Runcorn. Rooms are fine, in fact now they have newly installed PVC double glazing at last, as the old metal ones were rotten. Room service on my stay was unusually slow, taking almost an hour to be delivered. Staff are effiecent and the public areas clean and tidt, the lounge having a large screen TV on which they show all the football. Although being a Platinum PCM I didn`t get an upgrade but was recognised with drinks and chocolate. All in all I will as many times before stay here again.
reviews.title: Its OK trust me!

reviews.text: I have stayed in many Holiday Inn's and must say this is by far the best, located within easy access to everywhere via the motorway. The things that stood out to me the most were the cleanliness of the hotel area's and guest rooms.....everything was spotless and to say the staff were helpful would be a massive understatement, they seemed to know what they were doing at all times and nothing was to much trouble. Whether there for business or leisure this is your hotel, I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: People with a passion

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and tidy with a good bar , the staff were very welcoming and professional, the breakfast girls were very warm and funny...
reviews.title: Very nice and homely

reviews.text: Stayed here three times in 4 weeks on business. Positives, for a 3-star the pool and gym are quite a bonus. Not huge, but not busy either so got good use of them. The rooms can be very small - 3rd week had a bigger room. Rooms seemed to be v clean, but randomly fitted out with trouser press, wardrobes, fridges etc. Staff were very friendly and helpful too.
reviews.title: Very average...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives - Bar was very mediocre with a poor beer selection - lager, lager or lager! (Almost - but you get the point). The 'restaurant' is like a school cafeteria, for Brewers-Fayre standard food, quite expensive. Also, seems to be very popular with coach parties so can get very busy at the one bar which can often be understaffed.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Overall - fine as a 1-night bolthole for business travel, not for a romantic tryst though!
reviews.title: A Reasonable Standard Holiday Inn

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel August 2011 for one night. Arrived about 3pm, check in was very quick and swift.
reviews.title: Pleasent Overnight Stay

reviews.text: Room: was surprisingly small for the size of the hotel. I mean it was enough for us as we were only staying for one night but in regards to an average hotel room it was very small. Lots of cupboard space. Had a kettle, tea and coffee. Desk and flat screen TV.
reviews.title: Grubby Hotel. Surly Staff. Worst Holiday Inn

reviews.text: On arrival I was greeted by a very friendly and welcoming lady on reception who was delighted to check me. The rooms are good and nicely decorated with new flat screen TV's and a new wireless system through-out the hotel.
reviews.title: Super stay!! Great staff and friendly welcome

reviews.text: Breakfast was great, even though there were several coach parties the service was still friendly and the food fresh and readly avaliable. Housekeeping were also friendly and always said good morning to me while making my way for breakfast in the morning.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I can fully recommend this site for business and leisure should you wish to visit Liverpool and Manchester areas as the hotel is pretty central to these areas.
reviews.title: Excellent for Business Conferencing

reviews.text: A credit to all the staff at Runcorn and will certainly come back if I need a hotel in the area..
reviews.title: Amazing Service - Great Location

reviews.text: Second time with have used this hotel in the last 6 months and this time was even better.Only booked it the day before we stayed with a really helpfull,friendly lady called Viv on reservations in the hotel( give this lady a rise she deserves it)Everything i had requested rooms on the 4th floor and all together she had sorted.Staff on the reception were as friendly and helpfull.Breakfast was great the staff were superb.Can't fault the hotel and will stay there again.Thanks to everyonex
reviews.title: Okay, but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would advised people to stay in any hotel in runcorn apart from the Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Wedding Night Destroyed!

reviews.text: We had booked the hotel for our wedding night as not going on our honeymoon to the day after. Had avised hotel booking was our wedding night. When we arrived at the hotel following our reception 1am. We were then advised by rude unprofessional staff no room was booked or paid for (I had confimation in my hand whilst stood crying in my wedding dress) We were then told we could not make any other arrangements and was left outside in the rain on our wedding night to wait for a taxi. As anyone who is married knows your wedding day is the most special day of your life and ours was destroyed by RUNCORN HOLIDAY INN.
reviews.title: Acceptable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have stayed at a Holiday Inn before then this is the same as all the others - clean, tidy, and good value for what you pay but nothing special. Breakfast provided all the usual basic offerings, but no fresh fruit, bakery bread etc, no luxury but you won't starve either! Personally I had a poor night's sleep due to noise from the adjoining room, which could obviously be used as an interconnecting room. I had to put a spare pillow by the connecting door to stop the light coming underneath, and although the guests were not especially noisy I could hear every word they said (albeit Japaneese!), the same again in the morning which due to them arriving late at night and getting up early in the morning ruined my sleep. I am presuming I was just unlucky?
reviews.title: Great overnight stay

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night while in the area for a family party. Got an excellent rate for the night. The room, although smallish, was clean and comfortable and had everything we needed for our stay. The pool and jaccuzi were a bonus.
reviews.title: Nice and tidy, but small rooms

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Holdiay Inn. We did book executive rooms though, and I thought they would be bigger than they were, it was a small bathroom as well. But it was clean and had a HUGE tv, so for the price we paid it was a nice stay.
reviews.title: Not much to look at but surprisingly good

description: The Holiday Inn Runcorn enjoys an excellent location close to M56 Jct 12 and with close proximity to Chester, Liverpool and Manchester . This Runcorn hotel is an excellent base for visiting local attractions such as Chester Zoo, Cheshire Oakes, Liverpool FC and Manchester United FC. The Hotel combines an excellent range of facilities for both business and leisure travellers including Kids Stay & Eat Free*. Facilities include 153 bedrooms including standard, executive, family and accessible rooms, all are fully air-conditioned and have High Speed Internet Access. Conference and banqueting facilities for up to 500 people and a Spirit Health and Leisure Club which includes a swimming pool. The hotel boasts 11 meeting rooms that cater for all requirements from training courses, meetings to weddings and dinner dances. Complimentary and accessible car parking is available.The Spirit Health and Leisure club offers a gym and a large indoor heated swimming pool.
